title: Finite sums in monoids
content: UPDATE: a similar summation is already defined as ~ df-gsum (although it mixes finite and infinite sums, which makes it harder to understand).

blocks.name: cfinsum
blocks.content: Syntax for the class "finite summation in monoids".

blocks.name: df-bj-finsum
blocks.content: Finite summation in commutative monoids. This finite summation function can be extended to pairs ` <. y , z >. ` where ` y ` is a left-unital magma and ` z ` is defined on a totally ordered set (choosing left-associative composition), or dropping unitality and requiring nonempty families, or on any monoids for families of permutable elements, etc. We use the term "summation", even though the definition stands for any unital, commutative and associative composition law. (Contributed by BJ, 9-Jun-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-bj-finsum(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7) {
  |- wceq(cfinsum, cmpt(s0, copab(s1, s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), ccmn), wrex(s3, cfn, wf(cv(s2), cv(s3), cfv(cbs, cv(s1)))))), cio(s4, wrex(s5, cn0, wex(s6, wa(wf1o(cv(s6), co(nat1, cfz, cv(s5)), cdm(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s4), cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), cmpt(s7, cn, cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s6), cv(s7))))), cv(s5)))))))))
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffss(s6, s7)
  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s5, s7)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s7)
  -| diffss(s3, s7)
  -| diffss(s0, s7)
  -| diffss(s1, s7)
  -| diffss(s2, s7)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-bj-finsum(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7) {
  ⊢ FinSum =(s0 ∈ { < s1, s2 > |(s1 ∈ CMnd ∧ ∃(s3 ∈ Fin,(s2 : s3 →(Base ` s1))))} ↦ iota(s4, ∃(s5 ∈ ℕ0, ∃(s6,((s6 :(1[...]s5)↔ dom((2nd ` s0)))∧ s4 =(seq(1((+ `(1st ` s0)),(s7 ∈ ℕ ↦((2nd ` s0)`(s6 ` s7)))))` s5))))))
  ⊣ d(s5, s6)
  ⊣ d(s6, s7)
  ⊣ d(s4, s6)
  ⊣ d(s3, s6)
  ⊣ d(s0, s6)
  ⊣ d(s1, s6)
  ⊣ d(s2, s6)
  ⊣ d(s5, s7)
  ⊣ d(s4, s5)
  ⊣ d(s3, s5)
  ⊣ d(s0, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s5)
  ⊣ d(s2, s5)
  ⊣ d(s4, s7)
  ⊣ d(s3, s7)
  ⊣ d(s0, s7)
  ⊣ d(s1, s7)
  ⊣ d(s2, s7)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: bj-finsumval0
blocks.content: Value of a finite sum. (Contributed by BJ, 9-Jun-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-finsumval0(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cfinsum, c1), cio(s0, wrex(s1, cn0, wex(s2, wa(wf1o(cv(s2), co(nat1, cfz, cv(s1)), c2), wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cmpt(s3, cn, cfv(c1, cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3))))), cfv(chash, c2)))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c0)))

  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
